intro: Crataegus operta, commonly known as the European hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters and features thorny branches, oval to ovate leaves, and white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces red or orange berries in the fall, which are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Botanically, it is characterized by its pome fruits and is part of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and apples.
